data.title: Check out 17 of the best gangster movies on Netflix
data.meta_description: Looking for the best gangster movies on Netflix? Here's a list of the best films that are available to watch on the streaming service.
data.text:
Netflix

Are you looking to watch a movie with big crimes, lots of guns, and an unhealthy dose of profanity? Fuhgeddaboutit! We’re here to tell you about the best gangster movies on Netflix right now. If you haven’t ditched the streamer for one of its alternatives, you’ll know there are tons of new shows and movies to check out every week, including plenty of crime titles.

Netflix’s selection of gangster movies is robust, but many of the heavy hitters are missing. For example, the series of Godfather films and Goodfellas are nowhere to be found on the service. However, there are some bonafide classics available, as well as a few off-the-beaten-path gems you should check out. Don’t have Netflix? You can sign up at the link below.

Netflix

Netflix is still the leading premium streaming service, with over 200 million worldwide subscribers. It offers thousands of movies and TV shows to binge watch, including its always growing list of original films and series, including Stranger Things, The Witcher, Bridgerton, and many more.

The best gangster movies on Netflix

Editor’s note: We will regularly update this list of the best gangster movies on Netflix as films come and go from the service.

The Raid 2 (2014)

Netflix

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 150 minutes

Director: Gareth Evans

Main cast: Iko Uwais, Arifin Putra, Oka Antara, Tio Pakusadewo, Alex Abbad, Julie Estelle

Genre: Action/crime/martial arts

Ratings: 7.9 – IMDB / 82% – Rotten Tomatoes

A sequel to 2011’s Indonesian action-thriller The Raid, The Raid 2 sees Jakarta cop Rama dealing with the fallout of his actions in the first film. Wanted by dangerous criminals, he goes deep undercover to protect his family from retaliation. Befriending the son of a crime boss, Rama gets deeper and deeper with plans to take down the criminal empire from the inside.

Featuring more stunning fight choreography, The Raid 2 is a terrific compliment to the first film and a knockout standalone actioner. If you’re a fan of high-octane martial arts, and movies like Headshot and The Night Comes for Us, you’re likely to love The Raid 2.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

The Irishman (2019)

Netflix

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 209 minutes

Director: Martin Scorsese

Main cast: Robert De Niro, Al Pacino, Joe Pesci, Harvey Keitel, Anna Paquin, Ray Romano

Genre: Drama/crime/mobster

Ratings: 7.8 – IMDB / 95% – Rotten Tomatoes

Nearly 20 years after Goodfellas, Scorsese and De Niro teamed up again for this 2019 Netflix original movie. The epic gangster film is based loosely on the real-life story of Frank Sheeran (De Niro), a World War II veteran and truck driver who eventually became a hitman for the mob and was involved with the late head of the Teamsters Union, Jimmy Hoffa.

When this movie was first released, many reviewers wrote about how advanced technology was used to “de-age” De Niro and other cast members to tell a story across decades. Thankfully, the technology takes a backseat to a gorgeous, heartbreaking story about cycles of violence. A spiritual sequel to Scorsese’s Goodfellas, The Irishman is a mob movie masterpiece.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie (2019)

Netflix

What you need to know:

Rating: TV-MA

Runtime: 122 minutes

Director: Vince Gilligan

Main cast: Aaron Paul, Jesse Plemons, Robert Forster, Krysten Ritter

Genre: Crime/drama

Ratings: 7.3 – IMDB / 92% – Rotten Tomatoes

A sequel film to AMC’s popular Breaking Bad, El Camino follows Jesse after the events of the series. A fugitive from the law, newly freed from the drug cartel that imprisoned him for years, Jesse tries to put his life back together, meeting numerous familiar faces from his past.

El Camino was a welcome addition following the Breaking Bad finale. Jesse was always a fan favorite, and the film proves he can easily carry a title of his own. It provides closure for the character while offering one last ride through familiar terrain.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Ferry (2021)

What you need to know:

Rating: TV-MA

Runtime: 106 minutes

Director: Cecilia Verheyden

Main cast: Frank Lammers, Elise Schaap, Huub Stapel, Monic Hendrickx, Raymond Thiry, Maarten Heijmans, Yannick van de Velde

Genre: Action/crime/drama

IMDB rating: 7 – IMDB / 88% – Rotten Tomatoes

Ferry is sent back to his hometown in the Netherlands to attack a rival gang by his boss. Once there, he meets Danielle and falls in love with her, all the while battling the gangsters he has been ordered to. The film explores complex questions of morality, redemption, and human connection against the gritty backdrop of organized crime.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

The Ruthless (2019)

Netflix

What you need to know:

Rating: TV-MA

Runtime: 111 minutes

Director: Renato De Maria

Main cast: Riccardo Scamarcio, Sara Serraiocco, Alessio Praticò

Genre: Crime/drama

Ratings: 6.2 – IMDB / N/A – Rotten Tomatoes

This Netflix original movie from 2019 comes from Italy. It shows how a young man in Milan, Santo Russo, started out in small-time crime while he was a teenager. He eventually became a major figure in organized crime in Milan during the 1980s.

Following a similar structure as Goodfellas, with several fresh and updated touches, The Ruthless is one of the best gangster movies on Netflix.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Heat (1995)

Warner Bros.

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 170 minutes

Director: Michael Mann

Main cast: Val Kilmer, Robert De Niro, Al Pacino, Jon Voight, Tom Sizemore, Diane Venora, Amy Brenneman

Genre: Action, Crime, Drama

IMDB rating: 8.3

A Los Angeles master thief and a determined detective are equally skilled and driven, and they respect each other, though they’re increasingly aware that their game of cat and mouse can only end in violence and death.

The first film to see Al Pacino and Robert De Niro share the screen, Heat’s reputation has only grown since its release, and it’s often listed among the best crime films of all time. If you like Michael Mann’s Collateral, Black Hat, and Miami Vice, then Heat is essential viewing.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Emily the Criminal (2022)

Roadside Attractions

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 96 minutes

Director: John Patton Ford

Main cast: Aubrey Plaza, Theo Rossi, Megalyn Echikunwoke, Gina Gershon

Genre: Crime/drama/thriller

Ratings: 6.7 – IMDB / 94% – Rotten Tomatoes

One of the best films of 2022, Emily the Criminal follows a young woman, buried in student debt, as she tries to get her life together. A criminal record stands in the way of high-earning jobs, despite her best efforts, so she turns to crime, taking part in credit card scams and working with criminals who show her the ropes.

Emily the Criminal is a searing indictment of America’s cutthroat job market and the treatment of millennials saddled with debt with few prospects at gainful employment. It features a stunning performance by Aubrey Plaza and is easily among the best gangster movies on Netflix.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Scarface (1983)

Martin Bregman

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 170 minutes

Director: Brian De Palma

Main cast: Al Pacino, Steven Bauer, Michelle Pfeiffer, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Robert Loggia, Miriam Colon, F. Murray Abraham

Genre: Crime/drama

IMDB rating: 8.3 – IMDB / 79% – Rotten Tomatoes

Scarface introduces you to a world of blood, drugs, and drama. The perfect recipe for any gangster movie. Tony enters a world of crime and quickly dominates it, but he is chased by enemies and the cops for his aggressive takeovers and tax evasion. You cannot go wrong with Scarface.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Last Seen Alive (2022)

Voltage Pictures

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 95 minutes

Director: Brian Goodman

Main cast: Gerard Butler, Jaimie Alexander, Russell Hornsby, Ethan Embry, Michael Irby, Bruce Altman, Jordan Salloum

Genre: Action/mystery/thriller

Ratings: 5.6 – IMDB / 13% – Rotten Tomatoes

A man falls under suspicion when his wife mysteriously vanishes at a gas station. Now, he has to figure out what happened to her as the authorities close in on him, and before it’s too late to keep her safe.

Despite some pretty unremarkable reviews, Last Seen Alive is a solid little thriller that packs a punch. If you’re a fan of movies like Breakdown or The Vanishing, or if you simply enjoy Gerard Butler’s action oeuvre, you should check out Last Seen Alive on Netflix.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Kate (2021)

What you need to know:

Rating: 17

Runtime: 106 minutes

Director: Cedric Nicolas-Troyan

Main cast: Mary Elizabeth Winstead, Miku Martineau, Woody Harrelson, Tadanobu Asano, Jun Kunimura, MIYAVI, Michiel Huisman

Genre: Action, Adventure, Crime

IMDB rating: 6.2

Trained by her guardian Varrick, Kate is a deadly assassin, always precise, and always in control. But when a mission in Osaka forces her to kill in front of a child, her moral code is shattered. A chance encounter with a charming stranger leaves her poisoned, with only hours to live. As she races against time in the shadowy world of the yakuza, she finds herself torn between revenge, redemption, and the unexpected bond she forms with the child from her past mission.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Donnie Brasco (1997)

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 127 minutes

Director: Mike Newell

Main cast: Johnny Depp, Al Pacino, Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby, James Russo, Anne Heche, Zeljko Ivanek

Genre: Biography/crime/drama

IMDB rating: 7.7 – IMDB / 88% – Rotten Tomatoes

Lefty, the leader of a crime family, takes Donnie under his wing and brings him into a world of drugs and danger. The only problem? Other than the violence and bloodlust, Donnie isn’t Donnie at all, he’s an undercover FBI agent. His real life, and wife, await him while the mob life begins to grow on him.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

The Night Comes for Us (2018)

What you need to know:

Rating: 18

Runtime: 121 minutes

Director: Timo Tjahjanto

Main cast: Joe Taslim, Iko Uwais, Julie Estelle, Sunny Pang, Asha Kenyeri Bermudez, Abimana Aryasatya, Zack Lee

Genre: Action, Crime, Thriller

IMDB rating: 6.9

Haunted by a violent act, Ito, a top Triad enforcer, goes rogue to protect a young orphan named Reina in Jakarta’s gritty underworld. As he’s hunted by former allies and lethal assassins, loyalty is tested, and betrayal lurks at every corner. Will Ito escape the shadows of his past, or will he become its next victim?

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Toro (2016)

What you need to know:

Rating: 16

Runtime: 105 minutes

Director: Kike Maíllo

Main cast: Mario Casas, Luis Tosar, José Sacristán, Ingrid García Jonsson, Claudia Vega, Nya de la Rubia, Manuel Salas

Genre: Action, Adventure, Crime

IMDB rating: 5.9

Toro, a young con man and key player for mob boss Romano, attempts to walk away from a life of crime. Tragedy begins, landing him in jail. Five years on, as Toro yearns for freedom and a simple life with his girlfriend, his past knocks on his door.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

Triple Frontier (2019)

Netflix

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 125 minutes

Director: J.C. Chandor

Main cast: Ben Affleck, Oscar Isaac, Charlie Hunnam, Garrett Hedlund, Pedro Pascal

Genre: Crime/thriller/heist

Ratings: 6.4 – IMDB / 70% – Rotten Tomatoes

A former Special Forces unit reunites for an off-the-books job. This one’s just for them after years of thankless service to their country. Using their skillset and knowledge, they’ll undertake a massive heist at a drug lord’s compound in South America, making their escape through a multi-border zone. But when things go south, they have to use their skills to make it out alive.

From the director of A Most Violent Year and Margin Call, Triple Frontier is a tight thriller about comraderie, loyalty, and desparation. It offers a sobering view of American military intervention and the War on Drugs, all wrapped up in a gripping heist.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

The Stranger (2022)

Netflix

Headshot (2016)

Vertical Entertainment

What you need to know:

Rating: TV-MA

Runtime: 117

Director: Timo Tjahjanto

Main cast: Iko Uwais, Chelsea Islan, Sunny Pang, Julie Estelle, David Hendrawan, Very Tri Yulisman, Zack Lee

Genre: Action, Thriller

IMDB rating: 6.3

When a man washes ashore and wakes from a coma, with only vague memories of violence and no knowledge of his own identity, he finds himself in a conflict with a powerful drug lord, and his phenomenal and mysterious killing abilities suddenly come in handy.

If you’re looking for high-octane action, look no further than Headshot. The film features unbelievable martial arts from some of the world’s best, including The Raid’s Iko Uwais.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

The Highwaymen (2019)

Netflix

What you need to know:

Rating: R

Runtime: 132 minutes

Director: John Lee Hancock

Main cast: Kevin Costner, Woody Harrelson, Kathy Bates, John Carroll Lynch

Genre: Crime/drama

Ratings: 6.9 – IMDB / 58% – Rotten Tomatoes

Notorious celebrity outlaws Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow are on the run in this 2019 Netflix crime movie. As they continue their crime spree, former Texas Rangers Frank Hamer and Maney Gault come out of retirement to help with the manhunt.

Sadly, Bonnie and Clyde, one of the best gangster films of all time, isn’t on Netflix, but this Netflix original offers an interesting perspective, showing how the iconic true-life crooks evaded capture for so long. If you enjoyed the 1967 film, check this one out next.

Ready to watch? You can find the movie right here on Netflix.

That’s our collection of the best gangster movies on Netflix right now! We will update this list as new movies arrive — or, unfortunately, some of the films on this list leave the streaming service.

You might like
